dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A

dialogue_turns.text: I'm not laughing, A. This... this actually, uh, makes me feel sick.

dialogue_turns.text: Sick? With laughter maybe! Robot Zuckerberg? A pact with the Kremlin for mandatory ads? Come on!

dialogue_turns.text: But the data doppelgangers, A. Imagine, um, controlling world leaders with an algorithm. That's... plausible.

dialogue_turns.text: Plausible? No! It's ludicrous. And Dorsey, like, under pressure from the CIA? Drinking with MI6? It's just a mash-up of spy thrillers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, if you look at the sheer power these platforms have, the way they could influence elections...

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The afternoon jousting added to a growing public spat between the two Internet moguls, both facing pressure to eliminate massive disinformation campaigns on their networks ahead of the 2020 general election.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Influence and control are different, B. This article is saying literal mind control by algorithms and, uh, North Korean hackers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Influence and control are different, B. This article is saying literal mind control by algorithms and, uh, North Korean hackers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, okay, but Zuckerberg's quote, "Free speech is for everyone, except those who don't agree with me." That's not far off, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, okay, but Zuckerberg's quote, Free speech is for everyone, except those who don't agree with me. That's not far off, is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I dont think most people want to live in a world where you can only post things that tech companies judge to be 100% true, Zuckerberg said during a Georgetown University speech earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's satire, B! It's obviously satire of what people think he's like. Not an actual quote.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's satire, B! It's obviously satire of what people think he's like. Not an actual quote.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I dont think most people want to live in a world where you can only post things that tech companies judge to be 100% true, Zuckerberg said during a Georgetown University speech earlier this month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, if he said it, it'd be pretty messed up. And the whole Twitter network designed to collect data for the US military? That's, uh, that's a big accusation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, if he said it, it'd be pretty messed up. And the whole Twitter network designed to collect data for the U S military? That's, uh, that's a big accusation.

dialogue_turns.text: It's an accusation that makes the whole thing fall apart because it's so incredibly unsubstantiated. It's a joke!

dialogue_turns.text: But it feeds into a narrative, doesn't it? Like, these tech giants, they're not really transparent.

dialogue_turns.text: They're not transparent about everything, sure, but this is like saying they're all space aliens. It's too far.

dialogue_turns.text: I don't know, A. I, uh, I think there's a lot to unpack here even if it's not literally true.

dialogue_turns.text: Unpack a fiction novel, maybe! This isn't news, it's fan-fiction.
